author: morningstar.com
title: Biogen to Cut Workforce by 11%
text:
By Chelsey Dulaney
Biogen Inc. announced plans to cut 11% of its workforce and end several drug programs to focus more on its key areas of Alzheimer's disease, multiple sclerosis and spinal muscular atrophy.
Separately, the biotech also said a late-stage trial investigating the drug natalizumab in treating a form of multiple sclerosis was unsuccessful.
Biogen announced the restructuring and the trial results with its third-quarter results. Revenue in the quarter rose to $2.78 billion from $2.51 billion, while earnings increased to $965.6 million, or $4.15 a share, from $856.9 million, or $3.62. Excluding certain items, the company's per-share earnings rose 18% to $4.48.
Analysts polled by Thomson Reuters had forecast $3.80 a share in earnings on $2.65 billion in revenue.
Biogen's stock price has been hammered since the company reported in July a slowdown in revenue growth for its biggest-selling product, the multiple sclerosis drug Tecfidera. Since then, the company announced the departure of its sales chief and analysts' expectations for the drug have been significantly lowered.
Write to Chelsey Dulaney at Chelsey.Dulaney@wsj.com
 21, 2015 08:01 ET (12:01
